q: a frequently parodied Donald Rumsfeld response to a reporter's question about whether there actually was evidence of any link between title="Saddam Hussein" href="http://www.latimes.com/topic/arts-culture/saddam-hussein-PEHST000983.topic"> Saddam Hussein and terrorists seeking weapons of mass destruction. The Defense secretary responded: Reports that say that something hasn't happened are always interesting to me because, as we know, there are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. Saying his`` heart was in Indiana,'' Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.

Bernie Sanders said in his letter that the nation's political climate had been damaged by a`` right-wing media echo chamber'' that is transmitting a reactionary world view to the tens of millions of millions of Americans who watch or listen to them every day. In a separate statement, state Republican Chairman Steve Larrabee said:`` By using this tragedy to demonize those he disagrees with, the Barack Obama is doing exactly what he pretends to deplore.''
